title: Adversarial Collaboration Contest: Loose Ends And Registration
summary:
Key ideas
- Scott is reminding people who proposed collaborations in the last thread to finalize their agreements.
- He is asking people to post in two separate comment threads, one for coordination and one for contest registration.
- He is considering adding prize money for the best postmortem after the contest.

Key learnings
- Collaborations need clear communication and agreements to be successful.
- Setting specific guidelines for collaborations can help ensure successful outcomes.
- Postmortems are useful for reflecting on the success and failures of a project and learning from them.

Key questions
- Who proposed collaborations in the last thread and how many of them followed through with their agreements?
- How much prize money will be added for the best postmortem after the contest?
- What can we learn from the postmortems of successful adversarial collaborations?
